metadata.description: Rename proposals for problematic scenes and events in 2024 April-July narrative analysis files

problematic_scenes.description: Friends at happy hour cocktails discussing ended relationships
problematic_scenes.reasoning: Scene name should capture the essence (shared relationship breakup stories) without location prefix, as location is already in metadata

problematic_scenes.description: Two women share pre-date anxieties over pints at Typhoon lounge
problematic_scenes.reasoning: Location is tracked in metadata; scene name should focus on the conversational content

problematic_scenes.description: Night has fallen, she shivers, hand on waist: 'Can I kiss you?'
problematic_scenes.reasoning: The moment is defined by the question asked, not the sidewalk

problematic_scenes.description: Glasses abandoned, don't hold hands, cold night, silent anticipation to apartment
problematic_scenes.reasoning: Captures both the temporal constraint and the emotional tension

problematic_scenes.proposed: You Do Know I Am Trans, Right?

problematic_scenes.reasoning: Direct quote captures the vulnerable moment more powerfully than location

problematic_scenes.reasoning: Already a strong name; remove redundant location prefix

problematic_scenes.description: Questions about preference, hesitation, electric mouth, faked orgasm
problematic_scenes.reasoning: Already evocative; remove redundant location prefix

problematic_scenes.description: Time to leave, doubt in grayish-blue eyes, phone accepted, closing kiss

problematic_scenes.description: Friends share relationship stories at Church pub
problematic_scenes.reasoning: Scene names must be unique across entries; this is a different April 11 scene from the later April 26 one
